name: The Howard Arms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we came back within a few weeks of our last meal, and we have always found the food to be amazing. but some faces were new, and if new makes our dining experience even better , then im all for change. being honest, front of house was always a bit messy, but the food always made up for it. this visit however was so smooth, no waiting for long gaps and very proffesional. so good infact we have decided to book and bring family over to share our anniversary. keep it up Howard
reviews.title: we have always loved our meals here............but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over for a night to celebrate a birthday. The hotel setting is fantastic and the room was lovely - almost like a boutique hotel (sperate huge shower plus roll top bath) Good choice of food for the evening meal and beer selection - cosy bar area. Excellent breakfast
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 30 June -1 July We had our Ruby Anniversary here and the weather was perfect, it was packed on the Sunday afternoon with a group in the beer garden, and the restaurant full to over flowing Our room was "The Village" which overlooked the green. All the room are lovely. Good evening meal, and good breakfast, Jane was very professional and helpful.
reviews.title: 40TH WEDDING ANNIVERSARY TREAT

reviews.text: We just had an overnight stay while we visited friends in the area. We were lucky enough to have discovered the Howard arms a few years ago but had never stayed there , what a treat!. The room , the study, was a beautifully decorated large room with an en suite bathroom complete with separate shower and roll top bath. We were staying with our son who had a z bed at the end of our bed, even with an extra bed in the room there was still plenty of room to relax. Our son was very impressed with having a DVD player in the room as were we ( bath in peace!). The breakfast is amazing as is the service and friendliness of the staff. The Howard arms is an absolute must if you're exploring the Cotswolds , my only regret is that we weren't staying longer.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Howard arms was the first hotel we stayed at for our 25th wedding anniversary holiday, it was a wonderful start, comfortable, spacious room with a fabulously comfortable bed, Helpful staff, great bar and delicious food all in a location that was central to the Cotswolds and attractions but very peaceful and quiet
reviews.title: Great start to a memorable holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't think of a better country inn anywhere in England. We spent two nights in the Village room, which overlooks Lower Green. It is tasteful and spacious, with a comfortable sofa and armchair. In many more cramped hotel rooms, the bed dominates the room, making it impossible to truly relax, but that is not the case here. The first night we ate in the restaurant, the second in the bar, and both meals were not only excellent, but good value. The selction of wines is also good. My only quibble would be our bed, which was a bit too firm for my taste, and it would be better to have natural duvet fillings rather than artificial, which can get too hot.
reviews.title: None better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a long weekend at the Howard Arms which is in the charming village of Ilmington (well worth exploring the little lanes and pathways throughout the village). We stayed in the Garden room which is a very nice, large room on the ground floor. We were concerned when we read a previous review about the lack of hot water in this room, but we found the water nice and hot at all times. We had our evening meals in the restaurant on all three nights and couldn't fault any of our meals. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. There was ample parking and we would certainly recommend the Howard Arms for a relaxing break in the Cotswolds.
reviews.title: A great place to stay for a weekend break in the Cotswolds.

reviews.text: We have just returned from our sixth stay at this wonderful, relaxing, peaceful inn. Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Another perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and welcome by all staff (especially Eve) is always unquestionable and warm.
reviews.title: Ideal Location for a Celebration
We went again on the next night - really good.
reviews.text: We cannot think of an nicer place to sit by the open fire or in the sunny garden to chat over a pint of Old Hookey before a guaranteed deep sleep in the most comfortable bed imaginable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You cannot miss the Howard Arms in Ilmington, it is a very typical English pub situated by the village green and decorated with lovely summer flowers. A very friendly lady showed us to our room, The Cotswold. It is a very spacious room, with a super king size bed, with lovely bedding and comfy pillows. There is an occasional table and two chairs ideal for having a pot of tea from. The bathroom is spacious with bath and shower. The extractor unit is outside the bathroom window but the double glazing quietens the sound. The room has 'proper clothes hangers and hairdryer' such a change to the hotel type fixed ones! Fresh milk and bottled water are available from a fridge on the ground floor. We had dinner the two nights we were there and together with the breakfasts cannot fault what we had. A very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Picture postcard pretty exterior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like a previous reviewer, we chose to stay at The Howard Arms for our Ruby Wedding for 3 nights over the August Bank Holiday weekend and we couldn't really have wished for more.
reviews.title: Great Location for Our 40th (Ruby) Wedding Anniversary

reviews.text: As on a previous stay a couple of years ago, our room was excellent, with views over the garden to one side and a neighbouring orchard/garden on the other.
reviews.title: Perfect launch-pad for Stratford and Shakespeare!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have enjoyed many lunches/dinners previously whilst passing through the village, but our family party of 15 for a celebration Sunday lunch (12 adults + 3 children) was very well looked after & the lunch was as expected.
reviews.title: Well Located for Touring the Cotswolds

reviews.text: The icing on the cake, apart from having our family with us, was that in the afternoon the Howard Arms laid on music and a barbecue in the garden. We didn't need any more to eat, but the music, from a couple of local musicians was enjoyable.
reviews.title: Sadly just opne nights stay

reviews.text: Gaia 522
reviews.title: A lovely pub in a beautiful village

description: On the picturesque village green of Ilimington, set in the crook of the Cotswold Hills, lies The Howard Arms, a stunning, 400-year-old Cotswold stone inn.The stylish pub and dining room provide the ideal backdrop for an appealing mix of old furniture, broad polished flagstones and a log fire that burns for most of the year. Upstairs, three beautiful bedrooms have been joined by five newly-built sumptuous and spacious bedrooms which all boast separate power shower and bath, free internet access and iPod docks. Ultimate luxury and comfort are the focus of each bedroom which offer beautiful bigs beds with hand-stitched and sprung mattresses, modern fabrics and a clever mix of antique furnishings to ensure that each room offers its own personality. As the Howard Arms is sited away from main roads or street lights, a good night's sleep will leave you revitalized and refreshed, ready to enjoy our 'famous' three-course breakfast.
